title: Add standalone single-file apology website (dark theme) with 5-step flow and evasive No button

requirements.text: Create a standalone, single-file apology website at `frontend/public/apology.html` that contains all CSS and JavaScript inline (no external CSS/JS files) and implements a 5-page flow navigated via a "Next" button.

quotes: All CSS and JavaScript must be inside a single HTML file. Functional Pages (Navigation via 'Next' button)

acceptanceCriteria: A new file `frontend/public/apology.html` exists and renders without relying on the React app bundle.
All styling is inside a `<style>` tag in the same HTML file and all behavior is inside a `<script>` tag in the same HTML file.
A "Next" button advances sequentially through Page 1 ‚Üí Page 2 ‚Üí Page 3 ‚Üí Page 4 ‚Üí Page 5.
The layout is responsive and usable on mobile screens.

requirements.text: Match the requested design system in `frontend/public/apology.html`: dark background `#0a0a0a`, text in white and rose pink accents, minimalist and classy styling, and load Google Fonts so body text uses `Poppins` and romantic headers use `Dancing Script`.

quotes: Use a clean, dark-themed UI (Background: #0a0a0a, Text: White/Rose Pink). Fonts: Use 'Poppins' for body and 'Dancing Script' (from Google Fonts) for romantic headers. Overall Style: Minimalist, decent, and responsive for mobile.

acceptanceCriteria: `apology.html` imports `Poppins` and `Dancing Script` from Google Fonts.
Body text uses `Poppins`; header/romantic text uses `Dancing Script`.
The page background color is `#0a0a0a` (or a visually equivalent dark theme anchored on `#0a0a0a`).
Primary text appears white, with rose-pink used as an accent color consistently.

Page 4 (The Game): Question: "Are u willing to forgive me bab? ‚ù§Ô∏è" Page 5 (Final): Text: "Awwwwweehh! Lvb u bab üíã"

acceptanceCriteria: Each page shows the specified text exactly as provided (including emoji).
Page 3 contains a visually distinct glassmorphism-style card with a soft border and readable apology note text.
Page 4 displays the question and both Yes/No buttons.
Page 5 displays the final text and an image element below it.

requirements.text:
On Page 4 inside `frontend/public/apology.html`, implement the forgiveness mini-game behavior:
- "Yes" button is static and visibly glowing.
- "No" button is always visible but effectively impossible to click: when the cursor hovers near it (or pointer/touch moves near it), it jumps to a random (x,y) position within the visible viewport/safe container area.
- The evasion logic must be robust: the "No" button must never move outside the visible screen area (including on mobile) and must remain fully tappable-looking but not actually clickable.

quotes: The Yes Button: Static and glowing. The No Button: Must be visible but impossible to click... jumps to a random (X, Y) coordinate within the screen... Ensure the 'No' button logic is robust so it doesn't move outside the visible screen area.

acceptanceCriteria: The Yes button does not move and has a clear glow effect.
The No button relocates when a pointer/mouse gets near it and also responds to touch/pointer movement on mobile.
The No button never renders partially or fully off-screen after moving (verified by clamping within viewport bounds using measured button dimensions).
Click/tap attempts on the No button do not successfully trigger a 'No' action; instead they cause the button to move again.

requirements.text: On Page 5 inside `frontend/public/apology.html`, render the image using the exact placeholder tag `` and include an in-code comment instructing the user to rename their chosen photo file to `our-pic.jpg`; add a soft pink glow around the image.

quotes: Crucial: In the code, use a placeholder and add a comment telling me to rename my image file to 'our-pic.jpg'. Add a soft pink glow around the image.

acceptanceCriteria: `apology.html` contains an `` element on the final page.
A nearby HTML comment explicitly instructs the user to rename their image file to `our-pic.jpg`.
The image has a soft pink glow (e.g., via box-shadow/filter) and is styled to look polished on mobile and desktop.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Do not add any backend changes; keep all work in the frontend static asset layer.
User-facing text in the build request and in the created page must be in English (use the exact provided phrases).
nonGoals: Do not replace the existing React-based flow/components unless explicitly requested; the deliverable is an additional standalone `apology.html` file.
Do not integrate Internet Identity or any backend persistence for this apology website.
Do not add external JS/CSS dependencies beyond loading Google Fonts.
